contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Atlantic}} The '''[[Atlantic Ocean]]''' is the second largest of the world's oceans. '''Atlantic''' may also refer to: {{TOC right}} ==Places== ;in Canada * [[Atlantic, Nova Scotia]] * [[Atlantic Canada]] ;in the United States * [[Atlantic, Iowa]] * [[Atlantic, Massachusetts]] * [[Atlantic, North Carolina]], an unincorporated community in eastern Carteret County * [[Atlantic, Pennsylvania]] * [[Atlantic, Seattle]], a neighborhood in Washington state * [[Atlantic, Virginia]] * [[Atlantic County, New Jersey]] * [[Atlantic City, New Jersey]] ==In transportation== * The [[Atlantic 85 class lifeboat]]s serve the shores of the United Kingdom and Ireland as a part of the RNLI inshore fleet. * [[Atlantic (1921 automobile)]], an obsolete automobile company * [[Fisker Atlantic]], a plug-in electric car * [[Atlantic (train)|''Atlantic'' (train)]], a named passenger train operated by Canadian Pacific Railway and later Via Rail * [[Atlantic (locomotive)|''Atlantic'' (locomotive)]], name of an early steam-powered locomotive of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad with a 0-4-0 wheel arrangement * Atlantic, a type of steam locomotive with a [[4-4-2 (locomotive)|4-4-2 wheel arrangement]] (UIC classification 2B1), <!-- this is a type, not a name, different than above --> * [[RMS Atlantic]], a steamship that sank off Halifax, Nova Scotia in 1873 * [[Atlantic (yacht)|''Atlantic'' (yacht)]], a three-masted gaff-rigged schooner * [[Atlantic Airways]], a Faroese airline company * [[Air Atlantic]], a Canadian airline ==In media== * [[Atlantic (song)|"Atlantic" (song)]], by Keane * [[Atlantic (film)|''Atlantic'' (film)]], a black and white British film * [[Atlantic Records]], a record company * [[Atlantic FM]], a radio station serving Cornwall, United Kingdom * "Atlantic", a song by Thrice from ''[[Vheissu]]'' * ''[[The Atlantic]]'', an American magazine founded as ''The Atlantic Monthly'' in 1857 * [[The Atlantics]], an Australian surf rock band formed in the early 1960s * [[Atlantic (album)|''Atlantic'' (album)]], by Theatre * [[Atlantic Entertainment Group]], a defunct movie studio company ==Companies== * [[Atlantic (company)|Atlantic]], an Italian toy manufacturer * [[Atlantic Broadband]], a cable company in Massachusetts * [[Atlantic (supermarkets)]], a supermarket chain in Greece * [[Atlantic Superstore]], a Canadian supermarket chain * [[Atlantic Books]], an independent British publishing house * [[Atlantic LNG]], a liquefied natural gas producing company based in Trinidad and Tobago ==Other uses== * [[Atlantic (period)]] of palaeoclimatology * [[Atlantic languages]] (formerly West Atlantic), a language family in West Africa * [[The Atlantic (Atlanta)]], a skyscraper in Atlanta, Georgia, United States * [[Atlantic (Los Angeles Metro station)]] * [[Atlantic (Staten Island Railway station)]] * [[Atlantic University]], Virginia Beach, Virginia. ==See also== * [[Atlantik (disambiguation)]] * [[Atlantic Beach (disambiguation)]] * [[Atlantic Championship]], developmental open-wheel racing series in North America * [[Atlantic Philanthropies]], a private foundation * [[Atlantic League of Professional Baseball]], an American professional baseball league {{disambiguation|geo}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Atlantic (Disambiguation)}}
